item.description:
Climate Change in New Hampshire


A presentation and discussion by Dr. Barry Rock

Sponsored by
The Seacoast Sustainable Living Community

When: Friday, October 5, 2007 at 7 PM
Where: Blue Moon Market
8 Clifford Street, Exeter, NH 03833


Come and learn about what our Seacoast climate may be like in coming years. Learn what you can do to help stabilize our climate.

Dr. Barry Rock is the former director of the Complex Systems Research Center at UNH. He is a Professor in the Natural Resources and Plant Biology faculty, as well as the Institute for the Study of Earth, Oceans and Space (EOS) at UNH. Dr. Rock has developed a number of pre-college (K-12) science education outreach programs based on his own research activities. Today over 150 schools across New England are involved in Forest Watch, one of his outreach programs.
item.name: Climate Change in New Hampshire
